channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very dangerous footpath bridge over Tirle Brook, Woolstone, 27th September
item.description:
Very dangerous footpath bridge over Tirle Brook on S.W. edge of Grange Farm, Woolstone. For several months one of the planks of this bridge was rotted and fallen through leaving a gap of about 20cm. Now more planks are rotted and gone, leaving a gap of about 2' (60 cm). This is exceedingly dangerous, due to the depth of the brook, and this bridge is the access to two footpaths to Oxenton. A repair is badly needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Grange Farm Woolstone Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pelican crossing lights damaged Swindon Rd Cheltenham, 26th September
item.description:
The pelican crossing lights outside university of Gloucestershire Francis Close Hall campus on Swindon Road have been damaged. The lights are all facing the wrong direction by about 90 degrees - this means that drivers travelling eastbound along Swindon Road don’t see the traffic signal at all. The bottom bracket connecting the lights unit to the pole is no longer attached. Number on the pole is 1

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Caledonian Inn, 60 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Central Reservation, 26th September
item.description:
A4019 Central reservation between Princess Elizabeth Way and B4634 junction is overgrown with weeds and covered in litter and other detritus. It is not being maintained on a frequent basis as we would expect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Tewkesbury Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive Graffiti on Bus Shelter, 25th September
item.description:
Bus Shelter 2601 0053 on Hesters Way Rd, outside Dulverton Court, has been vandalised with red spray paint and offensive words have been written in large letters (BUS W***ER).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dulverton Court Hester's Way Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Road surface is disintegrating, 24th September
item.description:
There are some large potholes at the top of Honeybourne Way as you turn left onto St George’s road which need fixing There is also a large patch of the road surface by Elim Church which need relaying as it’s disintegrating significantly. It’s clearly been relayed previously but is all coming away and causing hazards for drivers and cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Parent, 1 Saint Georges Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats in bins, 24th September
item.description:
Everytime I go to put my bin out there are rats above or under them. Yesterday there was a rat inside. First it was one now I’ve seen 3 at once. There is cardboard that has been there for months and boxes are dumped and not collected. I don’t want to touch anything as I’m afraid I will catch something. Please can this be resolved?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18a Portland Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 24th September
item.description:
There has been a steady stream of water coming from under the road which has now started to enter my driveway. If this isn't fixed soon this water will turn to ice in the coming months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Postings Stockwell Lane, Cleeve Hill
